channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Labrador trained to detect invasive Japanese knotweed
item.description: Mick and Mack, two fox red Labrador retrievers, whose mission is to sniff out Japanese knotweed, one of the most invasive plants showed off their skills at David and Liz Botley's home in Surrey.

item.title: Supreme Court rules Donald Trump CANNOT end DACA program
item.description: The justices ruled 5-4 in an opinion written by John Robers that Trump's 2017 move to rescind the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program, which Obama created, was unlawful.

item.title: England rugby fans could be BANNED from singing 'Swing Low, Sweet Chariot'
item.description: The iconic song that supporters belt out at Twickenham and across the world at away games may be axed as the RFU looks to embrace diversity and educate supportersa ab

item.title: Trump claims coronavirus might have been spread INTENTIONALLY by China
item.description: President Trump claimed China may have spread coronavirus intentionally, called COVID-19 testing 'overrated' and explained his beef with mask-wearing, in a new Wall Street Journal interview.

item.title: Pulling down statues won't end hate, writes Inaya Folarin Iman
item.description: INAYA FOLARIN IMAN: By caving in to protests surrounding Cecil Rhodes' statue, Oxford University has taken a wrecking ball to Britain's traditions of pluralism, tolerance and freedom.

item.title: Inhaler that 'lets coronavirus victims treat themselves' will be trialled out across UK
item.description: Scientists hope a new inhaler which spots COVID-19 early on will stop people entering the rapid deterioration phase of the illness in which victims develop breathing problems.

item.title: This cowardly surrender by Oxford University is a wilful vandalism of history, writes Daniel Hannan
item.description: DANIEL HANNAN: Yet again, the future of Cecil Rhodes hangs in the balance. Intimidated by a delirious mob, Oriel voted to remove the statuette of the 19th-century diamond magnate.

item.title: CCTV photos of 35 sought by police for protest violence
item.description: The Metropolitan Police said they are seeking people in relation to a number of violent public order offences which occurred in London during demonstrations between June 3 and 13.

item.title: NONE of the 1,100 migrants who have crossed the Channel in the past seven weeks have been deported
item.description: The Home Secretary consistently vowed to eradicate crossings, but just 155 of nearly 4,000 migrants have been sent back since January last year.

item.title: Donald Trump's own former National Security chief John Bolton turns on him in explosive book
item.description: There have been many sabre rattlers in Donald Trump's administration, but the fiercest was the walrus-moustached John Bolton. Now, the former National Security chief has turned on the president.

item.title: Photographer captures an abandoned house that belonged to a Civil War colonel
item.description: Bryan Sansivero, a New York-based urban explorer, snapped the images. Local historians estimate that the two-story, 14-room property was built between 1853 and 1856.

item.title: Retired Pope Benedict is seen on rare trip out of the Vatican
item.description: Pope Benedict XVI, 93, made his first trip out of Italy to his native Germany today to visit his ailing 96-year-old brother Reverend Georg Ratzinger in Regensburg.

item.title: Boy, 12, signs record deal after song against racism goes viral
item.description: Keedron Bryant, 12, of Florida, who turned heads on social media with his song 'I Just Wanna Live' following the death of George Floyd last month, has signed a deal with Warner Records.

item.title: Zika virus: Florida to release genetically modified mosquitoes
item.description: State regulators in Florida have approved a plan to release 750million genetically modified mosquitoes they hope could lessen the spread of disease by lowering mosquito populations.

item.title: Spanish warship steams into British waters off Gibraltar during Royal Navy training exercise
item.description: A Spanish warship was escorted from British waters off the coast of Gibraltar on Thursday, after it incurred in the middle of a training exercise involving two minehunting vessels.

item.title: Teenager begs police to save him after stabbing at illegal rave
item.description: Harrowing footage, released by Greater Manchester Police today, shows the 18-year-old repeatedly beg officers to save his life following an illegal rave in Carrington this weekend.

item.title: Ex-Google chief warns Huawei poses a national security threat to Britain
item.description: Sir John Sawers, who was in charge of MI6 from 2009 up until 2014, has said creating a rival company to the Chinese telecoms firm Huawei would take 'two or three decades'.

item.title: Shaun Williamson takes on Lucy Fallon on Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family quiz
item.description: Celebrity interior designer Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen took on TV doctor Dr Ranj Singh in the fourth episode of ITV's new 'Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family' tonight.

item.title: Black man died in police custody after cycling without light
item.description: Byron Williams, 50, died in police custody after he was heard telling officers 'I can't breathe' at least 17 times after he was arrested for cycling without a safety light in Las Vegas last September.

item.title: HENRY DEEDES on the Foreign Secretary's newfound sense of humour
item.description: HENRY DEEDES: Ever since the Prime Minister returned to work - relieving him of the duties of stand-in - there has been a hitherto unseen joviality about him.

item.title: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Sarah Ferguson flies high with relaunch of her Budgie books
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Sarah, Duchess of York has spent lockdown preparing to relaunch Budgie The Little Helicopter, the hero of her bestselling children's books.

item.title: She couldn't read music... but Dame Vera Lynn won the battle for the nation's hearts
item.description: Her unforgettable voice, crystal clear, powerfully projected, emotionally driven and instantly recognisable, rang out like a clarion call in Britain's darkest hour. Vera Lynn died yesterday aged 103.

item.title: RSPCA to make a 20% staff redundant due to drop in donations
item.description: The RSPCA, which has 1,600 people in its workforce, has announced it will be making one fifth of its staff redundant due to financial strain caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Eateries in Turkey install plastic domes covering each table to keep customers socially distanced
item.description: The transparent social-distancing tents have sprung up at restaurants across Turkey to encourage safe post-lockdown meals.

item.title: New photos provide closest look yet at secret US six-blade 'ninja missile'
item.description: A new missile dubbed the 'ninja', which has six blades in the nose, deploying seconds before impact, is believed to have been used in Syria on June 14, according to new video footage.

item.title: ROBERT HARDMAN: A schmoozing by Le Président in honour of France's war debt to Britain
item.description: ROBERT HARDMAN: After more than three months gathering dust and moths in a cupboard, the UK's red carpet was unrolled for the arrival of President Emmanuel Macron of France.

item.title: Barbara Windsor's husband feared giving her coronavirus
item.description: During Ross Kemp's ITV Special Living with Dementia aired on Wednesday, the actor, 57, said he experienced 'every other symptom' at the start of the lockdown.

item.title: New coronavirus tracing may not be ready by winter leaving Matt Hancock red faced
item.description: In a damaging U-turn, Health Secretary Matt Hancock said the tracing application system the Government had spent months developing would not work on millions of phones.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Health workers and at-risk to get vaccine first
item.description: The Health Secretary made the announcement in tonight's Downing Street press conference, saying ministers would be 'guided by the science'.

item.title: Leah Remini says Danny Masterson's rape arrest is 'just the beginning' for Scientology
item.description: Leah Remini has called Danny Masterson's arrest on suspicion of raping three women 'just the beginning' for the Church of Scientology.

item.title: HMP Doncaster prison officer fell 'in love' with drug dealer
item.description: HMP Doncaster prison officer Chelsie Stephenson was handed a suspended sentence after she was caught on camera visiting her drug dealer lover in his prison cell, she admitted to misconduct in public office.

item.title: It's two metres apart over here, mon ami! Boris Johnson dodges enthusiastic welcome from Manu Macron
item.description: The French president briefly appeared to want to hug the Prime Minister as they greeted each other outside No10. But he settled for a small bow and a retrained namaste greeting ahead of talks.

item.title: Meghan Markle and Jessica Mulroney 'no longer friends'
item.description: The Duchess of Sussex has cut ties with Jessica Mulroney following her race row with an influencer, a source has told Page Six.

item.title: MAGGIE PAGANO: Slavery's shameful legacy haunts the FTSE 100
item.description: When the British government abolished slavery in 1833, around 47,000 individuals involved in the slave trade were compensated for the 'property' they had lost overseas.

item.title: Hemel Hempstead thug gets 9 years' jail for brutal attack of ex
item.description: Ryan Brady, 26, from Hemel Hempstead, was jailed at Luton Crown Court today after repeatedly beating his ex-girlfriend leading to her being hospitalised for five days.

item.title: Councillor suspended as he said childhood cat was named N-word
item.description: Councillor Dennis Parsons used the offensive word four times at Monday's Cheltenham Borough council meeting, when telling a story about the name of his family's black cat in the 1950s.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Factory closes for fortnight after outbreak
item.description: The 2 Sisters Food Group today announced it was 'doing the right thing' and would cease work on site for 14 days immediately, after 58 staff at the factory in North Wales tested positive for Covid-19.

item.title: Kobe Bryant moved his fatal helicopter flight 45 minutes earlier
item.description: Kobe Bryant asked his personal assistant to reschedule the flight from 9.45am to 9am crash so he could watch an earlier basketball game in Thousand Oaks, California on January 26.

item.title: Amazon fought off largest denial of service cyber attack ever
item.description: According to a regular report from Amazon's AWS Shield division, which safeguards Amazon cloud customers against DDoS attacks, the attack topped out at 2.3 terabits per second.

item.title: Study of thousands of Europeans suggests coronavirus and blood type link
item.description: A new genetic analysis of thousand of Europeans, published in the New England Journal of Medicine is the latest to finds people with Type A blood may be at greater risk from coronavirus.
item.media:description: FILE - In this June 12, 2020, file photo, a health worker draws blood for COVID-19 antibody testing in Dearborn, Mich. A genetic analysis of COVID-19 patients published Wednesday, June 17, 2020, in the New England Journal of Medicine suggests a person's blood type may have some influence on whether they develop severe disease. (AP Photo/Paul Sancya, File)

item.title: Dramatic moment police tackle anti-French protester to the ground in London
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: The man is thought to have tried to run after the car convoy as part of a protest against 'French interference' in Cameroon's domestic affairs.

item.title: Netflix dramas 365 DNI and White Lines are criticised for 'romanticising' abuse
item.description: A UK student feminist group has critcised Netflix ove the racy Polish film 365 DNI, which sees a mafia boss kidnap a woman and give her a year to fall in love with him.

item.title: Real-life Rapunzel says her five-feet-long hair attracts men
item.description: London-based Malgorzata Kulczyk, 34, says men love her 5ft 2in mane, and can't believe it's real. The IT specialist said she has not visited a hairdresser in five years and prefers home-made masks.

item.title: Florida is hit with record-high daily COVID-19 infections
item.description: The number of new COVID-19 cases in Florida surged to 3,207 on Thursday, bringing total infections across the state to nearly 86,000, according to Florida's health department data.

item.title: Kate Ferdinand reveals she's PREGNANT! Star is expecting her first child with husband Rio
item.description: The former TOWIE star, 29, took to her Instagram on Thursday to share a sweet video of herself and Rio, 41, telling his three children - Tate, 11, Lorenz, 13, and Tia, nine.

item.title: Rouge, white and blue! Red Arrows and Patrouille de France take to the skies
item.description: The Red Arrows and their French equivalent, the Patrouille de France , took to the skies this afternoon to perform a spectacular flyover ahead of Emmanuel Macron's visit to the UK.

item.title: X Factor contestant, 55, raped nine women over three decades
item.description: Former X-Factor contestant Phillip Blackwell, 55, pictured, admitted raping several women over the course of 22 years at Warwick Crown Court.

item.title: Plants use odour camouflage tricks to 'hide in plain sight'
item.description: Plants have an upper hand in the ecological battle against insects by using odour camouflage tricks to 'hide in plain sight' and avoid being eaten, scientists say.

item.title: Cambridgeshire mother and her pregnant daughter who 'drowned' in 'catastrophic' crash
item.description: Marion Bunyan, 54 (left) and her daughter Jennifer, 24, (right) were both killed in a devastating crash in Ramsey, Cambridgeshire on the morning of Sunday, June 7.

item.title: Measles first spread to humans from cattle more than 2,500 years ago
item.description: Measles first spread to humans from cattle more than 2,500 years ago, likely during the rise of the first large cities, scientists in Berlin claim.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Tracking app dropped for Apple and Google tech
item.description: Health bosses in charge of the NHS test and trace system said the app didn't work on iPhones (pictured) and was only able to pick up on a shocking four per cent of nearby contacts.

item.title: Babies born to mothers infected with Covid-19 'already have antibodies against the virus'
item.description: Dr Patrick O'Brien, vice president of the Royal College of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists, said a small number of babies developed an immune response against the virus before they were born.

item.title: Britain's property wish list in the areas with the biggest rise in demand
item.description: Accrington, Bolton, Rotherham, Wigan and Bradford are the top five areas which have seen the biggest rise in demand for properties according to Zoopla.

item.title: John Bolton's book says Iran deal pull-out was put off to let Melania launch Be Best
item.description: President Trump postponed removing U.S. from Iran deal so Melania could announce Be Best, said he'd be nominated for a Noble Peace Prize and claimed he always broke up with women he dated.

item.title: Amazon UK boss Douglas Gurr is appointed new director of the Natural History Museum
item.description: Head of Amazon UK Douglas Gurr has been named as the new director of the Natural History Museum. Mr Gurr will leave Amazon after nine years to begin his new role later in 2020.

item.title: Girls are four times less likely to study maths-intensive subjects at university than boys
item.description: Some subjects have a one to one male and female ratio, but university courses in physics, engineering and computer science have a much wider gender gap.

item.title: More than 250 former pupils accuse top private school of racism in joint letter
item.description: Current and former pupils at the Norwich School are calling for teachers to be trained in 'everyday racism' and requested changes to the curriculum after raising allegations of racist abuse.

item.title: Five bear cubs enjoy playground slide in family's back yard
item.description: The adorable cubs were captured in a backyard in Asheville, North Carolina. Footage shows the bears play fighting on the slide and pushing swings.

item.title: Sadistic killer who decapitated teen victim is deported to Britain
item.description: Tyneside-born Christopher Clark Jones, 36, was jailed for life after murdering 17-year-old homeless teenager Morgan Jay Shepherd at Sandgate, north of Brisbane , in 2005.

item.title: UK Weather: Thunderstorms hit UK a THIRD day with 2.4" rain
item.description: The Met Office has put a yellow weather alert in place for much of England and large parts of Wales tonight and warned up to half an inch of rain could fall in most parts of the country.

item.title: Coronavirus Northern Ireland: Hairdressers open from 6 July
item.description: First Minister Arlene Foster revealed the moves, saying they would allow class sizes to return to near-normal levels - paving the way for all children to return.

item.title: Laurence Fox to 'continue to speak his mind' amid BLM protests
item.description: The star of ITV drama Lewis, said it was a 'cause of sadness' at the possible loss of his career that came after his appearance on Question Time.

item.title: Police officers' son has driving conviction quashed after killing two pedestrians in father's Audi
item.description: Max Coopey, 19, killed father-of-three Jason Imi, 48, and John Shackley, 61, as they were walking back from dinner in Ascot, Berkshire in August 2018.

item.title: Will banks pay out over their slave history?
item.description: The City of London has now been dragged into the fresh scrutiny on Britain's chequered past which has pinned the spotlight on controversial figures of the colonial era.

item.title: Cecil Rhodes protests will CONTINUE until statue is removed
item.description: MP Chris Skidmore, 39, said the furor over Oxford University's Cecil Rhodes statue is distracting from the more important issue of 'equal educational chances now'.

item.title: Protestor who threw himself in front of Boris Johnson's car is ex-Kurdish freedom fighter
item.description: Diyari Kurdi, 48, (pictured) took up arms when he was 17 years old to join the Peshmerga in their fight to protect their homeland from the Iraqi dictator.

item.title: Protestor who threw himself in front of Boris Johnson's car is ex-Kurdish freedom fighter
item.description: Diyari Kurdi, 48, (pictured) took up arms when he was 17 years old to join the Peshmerga in their fight to protect their homeland from the Iraqi dictator.

item.title: Iran rocked by 'honour killing' as man kills daughter with iron bar
item.description: Reyhaneh Ameri, 22, from Kerman in Iran, was allegedly murdered with an iron bar as a punishment for arriving home late the night before. Local media say she survived for nearly 24 hours after the attack.

item.title: Dominic Raab attacked for BLM 'taking knee' protest comments
item.description: Dominic Raab said the gesture, which has been at demonstrations around the world since the death of George Floyd, 'feels to me like a symbol of subjugation and subordination '.

item.title: Feet of Jesus in Leonardo da Vinci's The Last Supper are revealed in 'gigapixel' detail by Google
item.description: The academy is the latest to join the Google Arts & Culture platform, where high-res image technology lets people view artworks and artefacts from across the globe.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 13-day-old baby among 135 new fatalities
item.description: Department of Health officials say the death toll now stands at 42,288. But the tally only includes lab-confirmed patients - unlike other figures that take into account all suspected deaths.

item.title: Ferris Bueller lookalike house on Grand Designs is on sale for £2.5million
item.description: The elevated design of five-bed Natural Bridges, set in an eight-acre wooded valley in Mawgan Porth, Cornwall, was inspired by the residence of Cameron Frye - friend of Ferris in the 1986 cult film.

item.title: Alcoholic killer monkey leaves one man dead and 250 injured after going on rampage
item.description: The inebriated imp, known as Kalua, was formerly the pet of an occultist who fed him hard liquor at his home in Mirzapur, Uttar Pradesh, India.

item.title: Chinese woman gives birth to boy from a frozen embryo 10 years after his twin brother was born
item.description: Ms Wang from Hubei, China, conceived her 10-year-old at the same time as her baby, who was born on Tuesday. She became pregnant twice via IVF using the same batch of sperm and eggs.

item.title: Prince Louis is 'obsessed' with Mary Berry
item.description: The Cambridge family's youngest son Prince Louis already recognises TV chef Mary Berry, and 'whoops and claps' when she comes on TV, a source has told The Sun.

item.title: NASA unveils the winners of its internal 'Photographer of the Year' contest
item.description: The esteemed competition celebrates the people behind the lenses at the government agency and showcases some of the historic moments at the space centers across the US.

item.title: Just 6.1% of Swedes have developed coronavirus antibodies, study finds
item.description: Sweden has opted for a more liberal strategy during the pandemic as much of Europe hunkered down behind closed doors. But a new study has revealed that the country is far from herd immunity.

item.title: Prince Charles' shares a more in-depth look inside his Birkhall study
item.description: Earlier today the Prince of Wales, 71, delivered a video message on behalf of his charity, The Prince's Trust, about the devastating impact the coronavirus pandemic has had on young people.

item.title: Coronavirus: Vitamin D deficiency is risk factor for severe cases
item.description: Scientists from Brussels Free University in Belgium found the risk of being hospitalised with coronavirus was a fifth higher in those who were deficient in the sunshine vitamin.

item.title: Jean Kennedy Smith, last surviving sibling of JFK, dies
item.description: Jean Kennedy Smith, the last surviving sibling of President John F. Kennedy and a former ambassador to Ireland, died on Wednesday aged 92 in her Manhattan home.

item.title: Toddler dangles from five-storey window grille by NECK in China
item.description: Heart-stopping footage shows the toddler helplessly kicking her legs in the air while dangling down by the neck at nearly 50 feet above the ground in southern China on Sunday.

item.title: Migrant waves in celebration as he arrives in UK
item.description: It comes a day after 42 reached Britain in four boats - meaning 2,127 migrants have crossed the Channel this year. The migrants will be taken into the Port of Dover in Kent to be questioned.

item.title: Harry Dunn's family LOSE battle to see 'immunity agreement'
item.description: Harry Dunn, 19, was killed in August last year when his motorbike crashed into Anne Sacoolas' Volvo driving on the wrong side of the road outside RAF Croughton in Northamptonshire.

item.title: Snouts make flat-faced dogs TWICE as likely to get heat stroke
item.description: Scientists from Nottingham Trent University found short-nosed dogs can not cool down effectively. One in seven canines diagnosed with the condition sadly die as a direct result.

item.title: Tsunami warning is cancelled after massive 7.4 magnitude earthquake rocked New Zealand
item.description: A 7.4 magnitude earthquake has struck north-east of New Zealand. The quake hit at a depth of about 33 kilometres, south of the Kermadec Islands.

item.title: Indian soldiers 'beaten to death and mutilated' by Chinese
item.description: The Indians today claimed that after their men were savaged with nail-studded clubs, the Chinese People's Liberation Army mutilated their corpses at the disputed Himalayan border on Monday.

item.title: Dame Vera Lynn dies at 103, six weeks after last performance
item.description: Forces' Sweetheart Dame Vera Lynn who entertained troops with morale-boosting visits to the front line during the Second World War has died aged 103, her family said today.

item.title: Police officer who threatened to 'make something up' to arrest man faces gross disciplinary charge
item.description: Footage shows an officer aggressively challenging Adam Kidger (right), 24, on April 17 in Accrington, Lancashire. Mr Kidger claims he was pulled over in his car after going out to buy a quad bike.

item.title: Iran test fires 'next generation' cruise missiles in Gulf
item.description: Official IRNA news agency said the missiles destroyed targets at a distance of 170 miles (280 kilometers) in the Gulf of Oman and Indian Ocean.

item.title: Aston Villa's Jack Grealish charged for crashing into cars
item.description: The Premier league footballer, who earns £45,000 a week, was postal charged over the incident in Dickens Heath, Solihull, on March 29 and is due to appear at court on August 25.

item.title: German tech giant Wirecard admits £1.7BILLION in cash has gone MISSING
item.description: Auditor EY was unable to confirm the existence of 1.9 billion euros ($2.1 billion) in cash balances on trust accounts, representing around a quarter of its balance sheet.

item.title: Rape investigations being 'systematically' dropped by police when victims refuse to hand over phones
item.description: Big Brother Watch says data shows that in 100 per cent of cases where a rape victim had refused what it calls a 'digital strip search', detectives later dropped the case.

item.title: Fortnum & Mason is now offering a high-end delivery service - including £225 Beluga caviar
item.description: Fortnum & Mason has partnered with high-end delivery app SUPPER so that customers can enjoy the likes of beef wellington and caviar in the comfort of their own homes.

item.title: Dog and dolphin play a game of chase through waves on beach
item.description: Anastasia Vinnikova filmed her dog Patrick playing with the dolphin at Opuk in Crimea. The dog touches the dolphin's tail in the game of chase before it turns back into the Black Sea.

item.title: Couple are thrown surprise lockdown wedding at the care home where they work
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Care home manager Lisa Sellens and senior care assistant Shane White, both of Southampton, had been saving for a year to afford their £5,000 nuptials in Cala Millor, Majorca.

item.title: Coronavirus: Lord Sugar says UK should lift lockdown measures
item.description: Lord Sugar, who has been staying with his wife in Florida for the last six months, told Jeremy Vine today that he believes the Prime Minister has been 'too cautious' in easing lockdown measures.

item.title: Former cocaine addicts detail the horrific realities of the drug
item.description: People who have used, and been addicted to, cocaine detailed their worst experiences with it on Reddit.

item.title: Finger-prick blood test could revolutionise cancer treatment
item.description: A simple finger-prick blood test that's up to ten times more sensitive than current methods could revolutionise cancer treatment, researchers at the University of Cambridge say.

item.title: Tributes pour in for Forces' sweetheart Dame Vera Lynn
item.description: Captain Tom Moore said Dame Vera had a 'huge impact' on him when they met in Burma (now Myanmar) after he was stationed out there during WWII.

item.title: Sophie Wessex hailed 'royal key worker' for making big difference in an 'understated' way
item.description: In response to her volunteering efforts amid the coronavirus pandemic, royal expert Joe Little, managing editor of Majesty, branded Sophie Wessex, 55, a 'royal key worker.'

item.title: Muslim convert, 14, 'made bombs containing shrapnel and recorded a martyrdom video'
item.description: The teenager, from Eastleigh, Hampshire, is accused of developing an extremist jihadist mindset in the past month after converting to Islam earlier this year. He gave a 'not guilty' plea at court today.

item.title: Grenfell Tower fire: Seven families STILL waiting to be rehoused
item.description: Seven households are still living in temporary accommodation and waiting to be permanently rehoused three years after the Grenfell fire, a new Kensington and Chelsea council report says.

item.title: California bridge accident kills four people include pregnant woman after the SUV goes over the edge
item.description: Four people, including two teens and a 21-year-old, died Tuesday night when the SUV they were traveling in plunged off the Carquinez Bridge, according to the California Highway patrol.

item.title: Have you received a P800 tax calculation? Five things you need to check
item.description: Every year, HMRC undertakes a tax review for each of the millions of taxpayers on pay-as-you-earn across the country, without the direct input of any of us.

item.title: Mother-of-two reveals how she transformed her tired 1980s kitchen for just £300
item.description: Esin Prod, 36, of Broxbourne, told FEMAIL how she has been at home since the start of the pandemic, and decided to set herself the project of redecorating their old-fashioned kitchen.

item.title: Bono's daughter Eve Hewson is new star of Saturday night TV in Booker Prize adaptation
item.description: Dublin-born actress Eve Hewson, 28, plays Anna Wetherell in the BBC's adaptation of Eleanor Catton's award-winning novel The Luminaries, which airs on Sunday.

item.title: Mother-of-four, 32, who didn't know she was pregnant, gave birth to a 7lbs baby girl
item.description: Grace Meachim, 32, and James Meachim, 34, from Littlehampton, West Sussex, were adamant they would only have three children until 7lbs 5.5oz Sienna made a very unexpected appearance.

item.title: Hong Kong security law draft to be put before China's top parliament body
item.description: China plans to punish those who disobey the national security law in Hong Kong as the country's top parliament body is reviewing the controversial bill in Beijing, state media has revealed.

item.title: Google Chrome extension downloaded spyware, security firm reveals
item.description: Security researchers have discovered malware that compromised users through downloads of extensions to Google's Chrome web browser.

item.title: Sadiq Khan urges PM to make shoppers wear face masks
item.description: London´s Mayor Sadiq Khan has written to the Prime Minister requesting the extra step to help limit the spread of coronavirus by obliging shoppers to cover their faces while in stores.

item.title: Tricky optical illusion challenges puzzlers to find all of the triangles in the image
item.description: The drawing - which was shared on the website for US-based Optics4Kids - is a Kanizsa Triangle and offers no clues to how many triangles are present in the picture.

item.title: Irish police detective nicknamed 'The Bear' is shot dead in small town north west of Dublin
item.description: Detective Garda Colm Horkan, 49, was murdered in the sleepy town of Castlerea, after intervening in unfolding incident on his return to the station. He was allegedly shot with his own weapon.

item.title: Leading heart doctor, 63, hanged himself after fighting secret 40-year battle against depression
item.description: Father-of-three and leading heart doctor Adam Fitzpatrick, 63, was found hanged from a tree next to a garden centre near his family home in Wilmslow, Cheshire.

item.title: Queen gets more nervous about her horse races than she did on her coronation, royal author reveals
item.description: Her Majesty, 94, made the admission minutes before attending the 1953 event, according to writer Karen Dolby, who shared the amusing moment in her recent book The Wicked Wit of the Royal Family.

item.title: PIERS MORGAN: Hancock's dreadful handling of this crisis has made Britain a global laughing stock
item.description: PIERS MORGAN: There aren't many things that make me spontaneously shriek a profanity at the top of my voice when I'm watching TV.

item.title: No More Uncle Ben: Brand will change its 'visual identity' to 'help put an end to racial injustices'
item.description: In a move they hope will 'help put an end to racial injustices', bosses behind the well-known brand Uncle Ben's have today revealed they are set to 'evolve' the visual identity of its products.

item.title: Prince William sad at not seeing Prince Charles on birthday
item.description: Prince William's birthday will reportedly be 'tinged with sadness' as he won't be able to see his father, Prince Charles, royal expert Katie Nicholl says.

item.title: Kate Middleton delights with her online school assembly
item.description: Kate Middleton, 38, partnered with online classroom the Oak National Academy to deliver the address via YouTube, which was available for anyone to watch.

item.title: Elderly man pictured with young activist in viral BLM image is IRA apologist and conspiracy theorist
item.description: Jim Curran, 73, an Irish nationalist and 9/11 Truther, was photographed deep in conversation with single mother Rosie Grace Smith at the demonstration in London last weekend.

item.title: Can you guess which country each McDonald's menu item is from?
item.description: A McDonald's worldwide menu quiz, created by UK-based Vanarama, takes 20 unique menu items from all around the world and challenges players to guess which country each menu item is from.

item.title: One of Britain's top pole dancers dies suddenly aged 27
item.description: Jess Leanne Norris, from Bolton in Lancashire, was a two-time winner of Miss Pole Dance UK. In April she posted that she was finding lockdown 'so so hard' and that a lot of us are feeling 'lost and lonely'.

item.title: BAME people up to SEVEN TIMES more likely to be fined for breaking lockdown rules
item.description: Some 17 police forces were more likely to give FPNs to people from BAME backgrounds, such a Cumbria where they were 6.8 times more likely to receive fines that white people.

item.title: Gynaecologist reveals the 10 most commonly asked questions in her clinic
item.description: London-based obstetrician and gynaecologist Dr Shree Datta told FEMAIL patients frequently want to know if they should shave before an appointment and if their vaginal discharge is 'normal'.

item.title: Gynaecologist reveals the 10 most commonly asked questions in her clinic
item.description: London-based obstetrician and gynaecologist Dr Shree Datta told FEMAIL patients frequently want to know if they should shave before an appointment and if their vaginal discharge is 'normal'.

item.title: Six simple stretches to avoid back injury and improve your breathing, yoga expert reveals
item.description: Fi Clark, head of yoga for London-based fitness studio FLY LDN, shares with FEMAIL the six stretches she believes people should do throughout the day to avoid back injury.

item.title: Dog tired! Cessna the 'clingy' Shih Tzu struggles to stay awake in adorable footage
item.description: Owner Michael de Leon took the adorable footage in Zamboanga in the Philippines. Michael told Cessna to go back to sleep and said the one-year-old puppy is 'the clingiest dog ever'.

item.title: Why you should NEVER drink and shop! People reveal their hilarious alcohol-fuelled online purchases
item.description: The hilarious deliveries, posted online from people across the world and compiled by The Poke, include a bizarre 'crafting with cat hair' kit as well as a Mr Blobby vinyl.
